newsitem.title: USA: Gundle/SLT sees lower prices continuing.
newsitem.headline: Gundle/SLT sees lower prices continuing.

text.p: Gundle/SLT Environmental Inc said on Monday pricing pressure on its sanitation products and services will continue into the fourth quarter and will likely depress revenues.
"Looking to the fourth quarter of 1996, lower pricing will continue to impact revenues," chief executive Bill Reid said in the company's third-quarter earnings report.
"Aggressively managing the cost side of our business is a prime strategy to maintain margins in the current environment," Reid said.

The company had third-quarter sales of $71.9 million, compared with $79.2 million in year-earlier period. Quarterly net income was $6 million, or $0.34 a share, compared with a loss of $3.3 million, or $0.19 a share.
"While sales for the quarter were down, unit sales volume was up 11 percent. Pricing declined 18 percent as a result of the market adjusting to lower resin costs earlier in the year," Reid said.

For the third quarter of 1996, the company's gross profit rose three percent, while sales were down nine percent. Comparing the first nine months of 1996 and 1995, gross profit was up five percent on 16 percent lower sales.
